thread.title: Rutgers players, coaches and alums celebrate Indiana win on Twitter
thread.title_full: Rutgers players, coaches and alums celebrate Indiana win on Twitter

author: Dan Duggan | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Rutgers players, coaches and alums celebrate Indiana win on Twitter
text:
BLOOMINGTON, Ind. — Rutgers' dramatic 55-52 comeback win over Indiana on Saturday caused a reaction on Twitter from the program's alums, coaches and players. 
Check out some of the best tweets below: 
Rutgers Hall of Famer and former Indianapolis Colt Gary Brackett: I had the honor to talk to @RFootball team last night about finishing.. Great finish tonight men!! #60minutes #finish — gary brackett (@GaryBrackett58) October 17, 2015 
Rutgers Hall of Famer and former Giant Shaun O'Hara: What an amazing finish for @RFootball congrats to Kyle Flood & his team for battling back from 25 puts down on the road #KeepChopping #RURah — Shaun O'Hara (@ShaunOHara60) October 17, 2015 
Rutgers alum and Tennessee Titans cornerback Jason McCourty: Sucks for Michigan but I hope y'all saw that Rutgers comeback win! (J-Mac) — Devin&Jason McCourty (@McCourtyTwins) October 17, 2015 
Rutgers alum and New England Patriots safety Duron Harmon: Good win by them RU boys!! — Duron Harmon (@dharm32) October 17, 2015 
Rutgers alum and Cincinnati Red all-star Todd Frazier: I forgot to say Piscataway how bout those#Scarletknights babyyyy. Great comeback — Todd Frazier (@FlavaFraz21) October 18, 2015 
Former linebacker Steve Beauharnais: — Steven Beauharnais (@Beauharnais7235) October 17, 2015 
Offensive coordinator Ben McDaniels: Love the game, and the game will love u back. Awesome day to coach for RU! #Chop — Ben McDaniels (@BenMcDanielsRU) October 18, 2015 
Special teams coordinator/tight ends coach Phil Galiano: We BELIEVE. What character R guys showed. Never quit just kept playing. So happy for them!! #CHOPNation #believe — Phil Galiano (@Coach_Galiano) October 18, 2015 
Defensive line coach Jim Panagos: The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a man's determination. — Jim Panagos (@CoachPanagosRU) October 18, 2015 
Wide receivers coach Anthony Campanile: Said it last week you can't ask for better kids to coach. These guys keep showing everyone what this team is Really about. Love these guys. — Anthony Campanile (@AnthonyCampanil) October 18, 2015 
Graduate assistant Scott Vallone: Unbelievable effort by a group of guys who know what F.A.M.I.L.Y really means! Never stopped believing in themselves or each other #RFamily — Scott Vallone (@ScottValloneRU) October 18, 2015 
Offensive lineman Dorian Miller: So proud of my teammates and coaches. What a win! Coming out of Indiana with a W! #CHOPNation #rfootball pic.twitter.com/8FhS2mAf3X — ɖorian ɱiller (@Dorian_Miller) October 18, 2015 
Wide receiver Carlton Agudosi: — Carlton Agudosi (@Hungry_Humble22) October 18, 2015 
Wide receiver Andre Patton: — andre patton (@dreezy10) October 18, 2015 
Safety Kiy Hester:
